entry.title: Enhancing Your SAP Support Experience ‚Äì Sunset of Ask an Expert Peer
entry.content:
Your support experience matter! ‚Äì and we are evolving with purpose to meet your changing needs and provide you with the best support experience. As technology advances and business demands grow, we continuously refine our support strategy to deliver faster, smarter, and more personalized assistance. As of July 1, 2025, we simplified our support channels by retiring the Real-Time Support live channel ‚ÄúAsk an Expert Peer‚Äù in SAP for Me. This change is the beginning of a more agile and connected support experience.

What Changed?

To better align with your needs, we‚Äôve officially retired the Ask an Expert Peer option in SAP for Me. You may notice that the familiar button has been removed from the ‚ÄòBest Action‚Äô recommender in the ‚ÄòGet Support‚Äô application.

Why the Change?

By sharpening our focus on proven support live channels, we‚Äôre enhancing your ability to get answers when you need them. SAP is committed to delivering a consistent, intelligent, and outcome-driven support experience. After careful evaluation and customer feedback, we are consolidating our efforts into scalable and intelligent Real-Time Support channels that offer broader coverage and tighter integration into SAP's support and product ecosystem.

  • Faster Resolutions: By focusing on the most effective channels, you‚Äôll get answers and solutions quicker than ever.
  • Consistent Expertise: Enhanced live channels provides you access to the best expertise.

We encourage you to take full advantage of SAP‚Äôs Real-Time Support portfolio, designed to give you faster answers, expert guidance, and AI-powered insights when and where you need them.

What Does It Mean for You?

  • In SAP for Me, you‚Äôll now be seamlessly guided to our highest-performing live support channels like Case, Expert Chat, Schedule a Manager and Schedule an Expert.
  • If you previously relied on Ask an Expert Peer, transitioning to these optimized channels will feel intuitive and efficient.

üí°Good to know: Want to keep content from your previous Ask an Expert Peer sessions? You can export your history via the ‚ÄòCase List‚Äô application.

Note:
Ask an Expert Peer will continue to be available in the Ariba Help Center. You can find more information in this SAP Knowledge Base article: 2998816 - Ask an Expert Peer - Frequently Asked Questions - SAP Technical Support

Your SAP Support Team

entry.title: Discover how to get in touch with the SAP Store Team!
entry.content:
Discover how to get in touch with the SAP Store Team! 

 

 

First let‚Äôs understand that ‚Äì What is SAP Store and the types of solutions available on SAP Store? 

 

SAP Store is the online marketplace where customers around the world can discover, try, buy, and renew more than 3,000 enterprise solutions from SAP and our trusted partners. Available in more than 200 countries and territories globally, it provides customers with real-time access to innovative solutions to become intelligent enterprises and digitally transform business.  
 

 
 
Solutions from SAP‚Äôs partners allow customers to extend their existing SAP technology and solutions with a mix of free trials and paid apps and services. You can search for SAP and partner solutions by categories, including SAP product, industry, publisher, certification type, and more. Partners can grow their businesses using SAP Store to market and deliver their apps, add-ins, and integration kits to SAP‚Äôs global customers.‚ÄØ 
 
 

Now let‚Äôs see the types of solutions which are available on SAP Store! 

 

  • Business Essentials: Essential solutions for your business, published by SAP or SAP partners 
  • Extensions and Add-ons: Products, microservices, content and add-on solutions that require functional prerequisites 
  • API and Technical Components: Solutions that connect and enable data transmission between systems, such as application programming interfaces, technical components, and web services 
  • Technology Components: Offerings with a hardware component published by SAP or SAP partners 
  • Services: Delivered via SAP Global Services and Support, Service Partner, Business Services 
  • Training: Offerings related to SAP Education solutions and education offerings from other providers 

 

And you would come across a question, whether you need to be an SAP Customer to buy SAP partner products on SAP Store. 

 

So, let me tell you that it is not required for one to be the SAP Customer to purchase the solutions published by SAP store, but existing customers will benefit the most because, most of the partner solutions offered on SAP Store build on or extend SAP Solutions. 

 

 

Also you would have a question/concern as how your information provided is stored or transmitted in SAP Store? 

 

Let me tell you that SAP strictly follows the General Data Protection Regulation rules and doesn‚Äôt sell or share customer with anyone. And we work diligently to protect the security of customer information during transmission by using Secure Sockets Layer software, which encrypts the information provided. 

 

Also, only the last four digits of your credit card number is stored along with the expiration date of the card in the account. And the payment made on SAP Store by using credit card is always handled by SAP Partner Delego Software. You may go through the link for more details - https://store.sap.com/dcp/en/privacy  

 

 SAP Support cannot assist with any SAP Store questions. You must contact the SAP Store team directly. 

 To get in touch with the SAP Store Team, please follow these steps:

  1. Visit this link: https://www.sap.com/store.html
  2. On the right side of the page, click the globe icon and ensure your country is selected from the list.
  3. Choose the appropriate Solution Type and product, specify the type of assistance you need, then click ‚ÄòFind Solutions‚Äô.

 

 

 And here is the screenshot of the page for reference to find the right path: 

 

 

Additionally, you can submit a Support Request using the following link: https://store.sap.com/dcp/en/supportform

  1. Select the topic you need help with from the dropdown menu.
  2. Provide a detailed description of your query or issue.
  3. Upload any relevant attachments, if applicable.
  4. Enter your email address and optionally add CC email addresses.
  5. Click ‚ÄòCreate a Support Request‚Äô to submit your inquiry.


 You can go through the link to learn about frequently asked questions - https://www.sap.com/store/faq.html#about 

 

 

One last information which I would like to highlight is how you can cancel a subscription bought in SAP Store and the steps are given below: 

 

  1. Log in to‚ÄØhttps://www.sapstore.com/. 
    2. In the top right-hand corner of the page, click on your name and click on‚ÄØMy Account. 
    3. Click on the Subscriptions link on the left-hand side of the page. 
    4. Click on the Cancel Subscription link at the bottom of the page. 

 

 Please Note: SAP Support Engineers cannot do these steps. 

 

Thanks for reading!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
 
‚ÄØWe would love to hear from you, let us know what you think?‚ÄØ 
 

If you have any questions,‚ÄØplease‚ÄØfeel free to‚ÄØask‚ÄØus in the Q&A‚ÄØAll Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community‚ÄØand‚ÄØAll Questions in Support Services | SAP Community‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

 

Read more #Customer Interaction Centre‚ÄØblogposts‚ÄØHere!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

entry.title: All you need to know about SAP Cloud Availability
entry.content:
Being aware of your cloud system status and upcoming events taking place is a requirement to current businesses setup. SAP ensures that you have a seamless visibility about your cloud solutions by launching the SAP Cloud Availability application. 

 
But you might wonder, how can I access this feature? Well, let me guide you through this process. 

 
SAP Cloud Availability in SAP for Me 

The SAP Cloud Availability application is part of SAP for Me, which is currently the main entry point for support at SAP.  
 
To access the portal, you will need an S-user ID, an identifier issued under SAP‚Äôs customer and partner accounts to allow access to our main support platforms, such as SAP for Me.  
 
If you're unfamiliar with S-users, we recommend checking out this detailed blog post: Learn how to get an S-user ID.  
 

Now, let‚Äôs see how you can find the SAP Cloud Availability:  

  1. Log in to me.sap.com with your S-user ID and password. 
  2. From your homepage, click on the ‚ÄòSystems & Provisioning‚Äô dashboard at the right sidebar.  
  3. Navigate to the ‚ÄòAvailability‚Äô tab or locate the ‚ÄòAvailability Status‚Äô card from Overview tab. 
     

     


S-user ID Setup  

Ensure your S-User ID is assigned with one of the authorizations below:  

  • Display System Data.  
  • Edit System Data.  

Should you not have these permissions yet, please contact your company‚Äôs Super Administrator or use the Self-Service authorization request feature.

Finding your company‚Äôs Administrators
Locate your company‚Äôs Super, Cloud, or User Administrators via Users & Contacts‚ÄØ. Select ‚ÄòMy Important Contacts‚Äô tab or refer to the SAP Knowledge Base Article 3222501 for more details.   

Utilizing the Self-Service Authorization Request  
Request your authorizations by going to My Authorizations and Functions. Choose the ‚ÄòAuthorizations‚Äô tab and select ‚ÄòRequest Authorization‚Äô button.  
Detailed information and screenshots can be found on document 2891528 or on SAP Blog post How to use the Self-service authorisation request.  

Exploring the SAP Cloud Availability 

Accessing SAP Cloud Availability offers you a comprehensive view of your SAP Cloud services and systems, covering both productive and non-productive environments. Key insights include: 

  • Overview of supported cloud products (Check the list of all supported products on this webpage).  
  • Current and historical cloud system status. 
  • Planned events. 
  • Latest notifications. 
  • Communicated Availability Reporting. 

When reaching the application, the first card you will see is the Availability Status.  
 
It provides you with an overview of your cloud systems‚Äô status, quickly identifying unavailable systems or allowing you to filter for specific solutions. 
 

 

The three-dot icon on each card presents you with an explanation of the content; required authorizations; and data export option.  
 

 

 
 
Scrolling down the page, you‚Äôll find the Events card. This view enables you to check all events affecting your cloud systems in the last 12 months. It includes planned and unplanned activities such as maintenances, major upgrades, and service disruptions, allowing you to monitor the event status, impacted data centers, and other details.  
 
The card counts with filtering options as well as expand/collapse functionality based on your preferences.  

The Availability Reporting card displays communicated availability of your cloud services and systems over the past year.    


 
All of these details can be easily monitored and managed directly within SAP for Me. However, what if you want to receive email notification about system status updates, such as system outages, planned upgrades, or service disruptions? All you need is to subscribe yourself to the SAP Cloud Notifications.  
 
Check the SAP Knowledge Base Articles 2900069 and 2896942 for reference on how to subscribe for these notifications.
 
More information about SAP Cloud Availability can be found on the following resources:  

  • Cloud Availability in SAP for Me 
  • 2548400 - Getting started with the SAP Cloud Availability - SAP for Me 
     

Who to contact for support?  

In case of issues related to SAP Cloud Availability application, please create a case with SAP for Me technical team using the Get Support feature. Make sure that you select ‚ÄòSAP for Me‚Äô and ‚ÄòSystems & Provisioning > Availability‚Äô under product related fields to reach the correct team.  
 

More details can be checked in 1296527 - How to create a support case for SAP Support - SAP for Me.  

Alternatively, feel free to connect with the SAP Customer Interaction Center team for initial troubleshooting or navigation guidance. Our team is‚ÄØavailable 24/7‚ÄØensuring you are covered with a ‚Äúfollow the sun‚Äù support and service provided in‚ÄØover 10 languages.  
‚ÄØ 
Find the Customer Interaction Center official page and contact information on the following link:‚ÄØ Contact Customer Interaction Center‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
 
 

Thank you for reading! We hope you found this helpful and would love to hear your thoughts about this blog post. Let us know what you think!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
‚ÄØ 
Stay tuned for our upcoming Support Webinars and recorded sessions to continuously learn and get the best from SAP Support:‚ÄØRegister Now‚ÄØ 

 

Read more #CustomerInteractionCenter‚ÄØblog posts‚ÄØhere!

entry.title: How to add an additional user or e-mail address to the SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
You have an SAP Universal ID Account and need guidance on how to add an additional user or email address? Don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve got you covered with this straightforward guide! 

 

If you already have an existing SAP Universal ID, you can easily add additional email addresses in the SAP Account Manager and link associated S-user or P-user ID(s) using the below simple steps.

Here‚Äôs how:‚ÄØ 

  • First, login with your SAP Universal ID account email and password in the SAP Account Manager: https://account.sap.com/sam/landing. 
  • Next, click on "Add Identity" in the upper right corner of your screen. 

     

  • Enter the e-mail address associated with the S/P-user ID(s) you want to link and click "Submit".   
  • Confirm your‚ÄØsubmission by entering the verification code that has been sent to your email address.  
  • Click ‚ÄúVerify‚Äù. Then, the associated P/S user ID will be linked successfully. 

 

For more details, please refer to KBA:‚ÄØ2882908 - How to add an additional user or e-mail address to the SAP Universal ID (UID) - SAP for Me.

Note:‚ÄØAs per KBA‚ÄØ3360451, a maximum number of‚ÄØ10 e-mail addresses‚ÄØcan be linked, and a maximum number of‚ÄØ200 users‚ÄØcan be linked with your SAP Universal ID account. 

 

Note: 

During the SAP Universal ID registration (see KBA‚ÄØ2882963), after you verify your email address, you can link accounts or change settings of your SAP Universal ID by visiting the SAP Account Manager. The system will retrieve the IDs that match the e-mail address that you have verified & automatically link them. If no IDs are found, click the "Add identity" button (as outlined above). That way you can link your additional email addresses with their S/P-users IDs from the very start. 

An email address (with or without associated S-/P-User) can be linked to only one SAP Universal ID. If the email address is already a part of another SAP Universal ID account, the email can't be added to another one‚ÄØand SAP Universal IDs cannot be merged.‚ÄØ The relevant email address from the existing SAP Universal ID needs to be removed or, delete the entire duplicate SAP Universal ID first before you can add the email address to another SAP Universal ID account. 

 For more details on how to request unlinking S-user/P-user ID(s) or email addresses, and/or deleting the entire duplicate SAP Universal ID, please refer to the KBA 3619621. 

 

Additionally, an email address added without being associated to an S/P user will prompt you to make a choice with an "Action required" reminder as below:  

 

For any questions or issues with your SAP Universal ID account, please create a case under the component XX-SER-UID, or contact the‚ÄØCustomer Interaction Center (CIC)‚ÄØfor assistance and guidance.‚ÄØ‚ÄØKBA:‚ÄØ560499 - Customer Interaction Center: Hotline - Email - Chat. 

 

Helpful KBAs & Links:  

  • SAP Universal ID - FAQ‚ÄØ 
  • KBA: 2882938 - How to reset or change SAP Universal ID (UID) password - SAP for Me 
  • KBA:‚ÄØ2962360 - How to change the primary e-mail address - SAP Universal ID (UID) - SAP for Me 
  • SAP News Center

 

Got More Questions? 

Please note that‚ÄØthe‚ÄØCustomer Interaction Center‚ÄØis always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you may have!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

Alternatively,‚ÄØplease‚ÄØfeel free to‚ÄØask‚ÄØus in the Q&A‚ÄØ‚ÄØAll Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community‚ÄØand‚ÄØAll Questions in Support Services | SAP Community 

 

Don't Miss Out on Free Webcasts 

We would like to invite you to our free webcasts, which we believe can help you get the best from your support in SAP. You can find all upcoming webcasts on‚ÄØhttps://events.sap.com/supportwebcasts/en/home. These sessions are open to all the users and will revolve around hot topics in support today such as SAP for Me, Case Management, Universal ID, etc. Additionally, you can explore a range of CIC how-to videos at‚ÄØlearning.sap.com.‚ÄØPlease feel free to share this information with your colleagues. We are looking forward to your attendance. 

 Lastly, you may want to access all SAP CIC Blogs here:‚ÄØ‚ÄØhttps://community.sap.com/t5/tag/CustomerInteractionCenter/tg-p/board-id/crm-blog-sap. 

 

Thanks‚ÄØfor reading! ‚ÄØWe hope you found this guide helpful.‚ÄØ

entry.title: From Reactive to Preventative: SAP Support‚Äôs Next Chapter
entry.content:
Digital transformation raises the stakes for performance and uptime. That‚Äôs why SAP support is evolving from fast issue resolution to proactive prevention - powered by automation and agentic AI.

Watch the video to see how we combine always-on monitoring, intelligent risk detection, and expert guidance to keep your business running smoothly.

What‚Äôs changing and why it matters:

  • Automated agents continuously scan SAP environments to spot misconfigurations, incorrect usage, or emerging risks.
  • Machine learning predicts peak demand and flags potential bottlenecks before they impact users.
  • Identified risks are turned into actionable ‚Äúrisk objects,‚Äù categorized, and routed to the right mitigation path.
  • Non-critical issues can be auto-mitigated by AI, while customers or partners are engaged when action is required.
  • For complex or critical situations, SAP support experts step in with hands-on guidance.

This preventative strategy isn‚Äôt theory - it‚Äôs proven. With round-the-clock control room support, real-time monitoring, and proactive risk management, SAP Commerce Cloud achieved 100% uptime during the most demanding events of the year: Black Friday and Cyber Monday.

Our commitment remains the same: deliver exceptional support, earn your trust, and drive meaningful business impact through continuous improvement. AI helps us detect and predict; our experts help you resolve and optimize. Together, we turn insights into a seamless customer experience.

Press play to learn how SAP Support brings innovation and reliability together - so you can move faster with confidence.

entry.title: Stay up-to-date on your SAP Cloud services and system status with timely notifications
entry.content:
Are you interested in receiving timely communication about your SAP Cloud Services and system availability? This blog post will guide you through the process of getting notified about system status updates, planned and unplanned maintenance, service disruptions, and more. 

 
These notifications come from the SAP Cloud Availability application maintained within SAP for Me.‚ÄØTo better understand this feature and explore its functionalities, I encourage you to check these meaningful contents:  
 
All you need to know about SAP Cloud Availability
2548400 - Getting started with the SAP‚ÄØ Cloud‚ÄØ Availability‚ÄØ- SAP for Me 
 
 
Now, let‚Äôs get you set up to receive the alerts.   
 
SAP Cloud Notification subscriptions ‚Äì Get Notified 

First, you should consider there are two available options to subscribe for SAP Cloud Notifications. They can be added and managed either by yourself or by your company‚Äôs Super or Cloud Administrators.  
 
Please Note:  
Previously, some cloud subscription options did not require an S-user ID. When these subscriptions were migrated to the cloud notification application, non-users were also migrated.  Individuals that have subscribed for cloud notifications without having an S-user ID must contact their Super or Cloud Administrators to manage the subscriptions on their behalf.  

Administrators can manage the subscriptions for non S-user contacts from the same application as for S-user IDs. The ‚ÄòUser Type‚Äô filter can be a helpful tool to quickly distinguish between both scenarios. Below you'll find the steps and documentation reference for this. 
 
 
Subscribing your own S-user ID for Cloud Notifications 

Ensure your S-User ID is assigned with one of the authorizations below:   

  • Display System Data.   
  • Edit System Data.   

 

  1. In the Systems & Provisioning dashboard in SAP for Me, go to the Get Notified tab. 
  2. The 'My Subscriptions' will appear by default. 
  3. Select ‚ÄòAdd New Subscription‚Äô. 

  4. A pop-up window will enable you to select your subscription preferences.  
  5. Click ‚ÄòSave‚Äô to reflect your elections.  

Your subscription will now be added and can be managed directly from the Get Notified tab.  
 

To adjust your notification preferences or unsubscribe from an existing one, simply locate the subscription through ‚ÄòMy Subscriptions‚Äô and click on the corresponding icon based on the desired action (Pencil icon = edit / Trash can icon = delete).

Check the following SAP Knowledge Base Article for additional reference on this process: 2900069 - How S-users manage their own‚ÄØCloud‚ÄØNotification‚ÄØsubscriptions - SAP for Me.  

 

Adding Cloud Notifications for other S-user IDs as a Super or Cloud Administrator 

  1. In the Systems & Provisioning dashboard in SAP for Me, go to the Get Notified tab.  
  2. The 'My Subscriptions' will appear by default. Switch to ‚ÄòManage Subscriptions‚Äô.  
  3. Select ‚ÄòAdd New Subscription‚Äô.    
  4. In the pop-up window, enter the subscription options and the S-user(s) to get notified via the ‚ÄòContacts‚Äô field.
     
  5. Save the subscription selection.  

Once completed, Administrators can manage the subscriptions from the same application by locating it and selecting the relevant action. Options include adding subscriber, editing or deleting the subscription.   

Further guidance is available in the article 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users - SAP for Me.  
 

Support Resources 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, you can always refer to the following support options: 

  • Create a Support Case: For any technical issues related to the Get Notified application, create a case selecting ‚ÄòSAP for ME‚Äô and ‚ÄòSystems & Provisioning > Get Notified‚Äô under product related fields. Follow the steps from SAP Knowledge Base Article ‚ÄØ1296527 for further guidance.  
     
  • SAP Customer Interaction Center: For navigation or initial troubleshooting assistance, feel free to reach out to the Customer Interaction Center team: Contact Customer Interaction Center. 
     

Thank you for reading! We hope you found this helpful and would love to hear your thoughts about this blog post. Let us know what you think!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
‚ÄØ 
Stay tuned for our upcoming Support Webinars and recorded sessions to continuously learn and get the best from SAP Support: ‚ÄØRegister Now‚ÄØ 
 

Read more #CustomerInteractionCenter‚ÄØblog posts‚ÄØhere!

entry.title: Using the SAP EarlyWatch Alert Status App
entry.content:
SAP Note 1257308 - FAQ: Using EarlyWatch Alert provides preliminary information about the Status App. The app tracks the status of the SAP EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) from the arrival of service data through all processing steps at SAP. This app is intended for administrators to troubleshoot the EWA process. This blog will provide a more detailed description of the Status App functionality.

EWA session data can be sent to SAP through various methods. The EWA session data can be sent directly to SAP through the HTTP destination SAP-SUPPORT_PORTAL (via SAP-SUPPORT_PARCELBOX) from either an ABAP managed system or an SAP Solution Manager system. Additionally, any EWA session data for systems managed by the ECS team are sent via their SAP Focused Run systems on SAP side to be processed. The following Notes and KBAs are provided for more information on all three scenarios.

  • 207223 - SAP EarlyWatch Alert Processed at SAP
  • 1684537 - EarlyWatch Alert Not Sent to SAP: Troubleshooting Guide - SAP Solution Manager
  • 2930644 - SAP Focused Run: EarlyWatch Alert Troubleshooting Guide - Guided Answer

After sending EWA session data through one of the available methods it can be unclear whether the EWA data was successfully received by SAP or if there was any issue with the EWA session processing. The EWA Status App allows you to follow the status of your EWA report once it‚Äôs sent to SAP.

All EWA session data sent to SAP will be available for review in the EWA Status App, here you will find various details about the EWA sessions you have sent.

You can see the date the EWA session data session was sent, if they have been successfully received by SAP, as well as whether the EWA session could be processed successful or has been generated and posted in the EWA workspace.

Since the EWA session data packages sent to SAP are processed in randomly assigned batches for all customers it can take from a few hours to a few days for your EWA result to be available in various SAP applications like the EWA Workspace, Solution Finder, EWA Dashboard, or as a Word document available for download. Using the Status App allows you to track this process without opening a case.

The general fields available in the EWA Status App that are applicable for all system types are the following columns.

  • System
  • Product
  • Sending System Product
  • Data Received at SAP
  • Collected At

The ‚ÄúSystem‚Äù and ‚ÄúProduct‚Äù columns will list the long and short SID as well as the product version respectively of the EWA target system.

The ‚ÄúSending System Product‚Äù column, however, will display the product version of the system that transferred the session data to SAP. This is most often a Solution Manager or Focused Run system.  

Finally, the ‚ÄúData Received at SAP‚Äù and ‚ÄúCollected at‚Äù columns document the date and time the EWA session package was received by SAP as well as when it was collected on the managed system.

Data Transfer Status Details

In the EWA Status App the ‚ÄúData Transfer Status Details‚Äù column can have one of three status‚Äô. The status‚Äô are Rejected, Ignored, Success. As you would expect Success simply indicates the EWA session data was successfully transferred to SAP. The other two status‚Äô can be indicative of various errors. I will describe the most common in more detail below.

"Ignored (duplicate)"

This status indicates that the EWA is sent multiple times per week for the same system. You should check to see if the EWA is being sent from both Solution Manager and the managed system. The same checks should be performed for on prem FRUN systems. The EWA could also be sent multiple times per week from the same system. All will result in the same status.

"Ignored (not in allow list)"

This status can be caused by a few errors. However, the most common would be that either the license or maintenance certificate for the system is expired.

Recommendation:

Review the SLICENSE transaction in Solution Manager if used as well as the managed system to ensure both are up to date.

"Rejected (system time in future)"

The system runs with a system time deviating from official time. 

Recommendation:

The System Time can be synced manually by your system Admin. However, it is likely that this is a temporary change for testing purposes and it will sync automatically via Internet. If not working, your Admin can start this sync process at the OS Level.

 

"Rejected (no data)"

The service data that arrived at SAP is either not readable or empty or incomplete and thus important parts are completely missing.

Recommendation:

This would indicate that there are issues with EWA session data collection or service data quality. We recommend reviewing the resolution steps in the KBA 1824881 - Summary of Grey Rated EWA Reports - SAP Solution Manager.

"Rejected (non-productive)"

Only for productive and test systems the EWA is processed at SAP. Based on the system role the service data can be rejected. This is true for managed systems before ST-PI 740 SP23 (ST-PI 2008_1_7xx SP33) more information on the adjusted criteria can be found in SAP Note 207223 - SAP EarlyWatch Alert Processed at SAP.

"Rejected (not authorized)"

The technical communication user used for upload is not authorized to upload for this system.

Or

The technical communication user used for upload is not valid anymore.

Or

The user used for upload is not a technical communication user.

Recommendation:

You will need to ensure the S user assigned to both the SAP-SUPPORT_PORTAL and SAP-SUPPORT_PACELBOX HTTP destinations is a valid technical user. The following KBA outlines the requirements for the assigned user.

2174416 - Creation and activation of Technical Communication Users - SAP for Me

"Rejected (other reason)"

Create a case with component SV-SCS-EWA-GEN.

"Rejected (content size exceeds limit)"

The service data exceeds the size limit.

"Rejected (unknown system type)"

Supported technical system types are ABAP, HANA, JAVA and BOBJ. When extracting the leading system from the service data either no technical system type was determined, or the technical system type is not supported by EarlyWatch Alert.

Recommendation:

If using Solution Manager it is recommended that you review the system information maintained in LMDB. Ensure the technical system type is maintained and that it is a supported type.

In addition, in some scenarios is may be required to replace the SDCCN service definitions. The following KBA outlines the process and under which circumstances these steps should be performed.

SAP KBA 1765141 - When should the Service Definitions be completely replaced (Delete and Download) using the steps outlined in SAP Note 727998?

"Rejected (data too old)"

The service data that was sent to SAP was collected more than 112 days ago. Such old service data is not processed by SAP.

 

Details on Report Status, Dashboard Status, and Solution Finder Status

These three columns are relatively binary. The Status can either be ‚ÄúSuccess‚Äù or ‚ÄúMissing‚Äù / blank. In rare instances you can receive the status ‚ÄúError (Initialization Failed)‚Äù. In this instance a case should be opened in the SV-SMG-SER-EWA component area.

The Report Status will be successful when the EWA document has been successfully generated. Until this point this column will remain blank. As mentioned previously it can take from a few hours to several days for your EWA result to be available. If the EWA session data was successfully received by SAP there is no cause for concern if the EWA report is not immediately available.

The same is true of the columns ‚ÄúDashboard Status‚Äù and ‚ÄúSolution Finder Status‚Äù. When these applications are fully populated the EWA column status here in the Status App will change to Success. Prior to this the status will remain either blank or have the status ‚ÄúMissing‚Äù. Neither status is a cause for concern. If after several days the status of these columns remains unpopulated you should open a case in the SV-SMG-SER-EWA component area.

 

2 Billion Record Limit Status and Number Range Forecast Details

This column is system dependent. These checks are in reference to the maximum table size for HANA systems. The maximum table size cannot exceed 2 billion records for a HANA system without detrimental impact to the system.

However, the status ‚ÄúMissing‚Äù is most often applied to systems that do not have a HANA component. This information is not relevant to your system if you do not have a HANA Component and is not a cause for concern. You should review the EWA for the affected system to confirm that there is no associated HANA DB.

For HANA systems where this check was not successfully performed the status will instead be ‚ÄúNo Forecast‚Äù, ‚ÄúPartial Success‚Äù, or ‚ÄúUnconfident Forecast‚Äù.

These may be a cause for concern and your first steps should be to review the RTCCTOOL recommendations of both the managed system and Solution Manager. You are looking for any red warning objects related to HANA session data, ST-PI, or ST-A/PI.

More information about the exact limitations of HANA are documented in the KBA 2154870 - How-To: Understanding and defining SAP HANA Limitations.

Additionally, more information can be found in the HANA Sizing Blog.

entry.title: Future-proof your SAP support journey with Support Accreditation
entry.content:
Discover what‚Äôs new in the Support Accreditation 2025 release

In today‚Äôs fast-paced business environment, speed and resilience are critical. Organizations that fully leverage their SAP solutions are better positioned to overcome challenges swiftly, avoid disruptions, and generate long-term value. That‚Äôs where Support Accreditation comes in ‚Äî your guided path to mastering SAP‚Äôs intelligent support capabilities.

Support Accreditation is a free, self-enabled learning journey that empowers SAP customers, partners, and employees with the requisite knowledge of SAP‚Äôs support offerings and tools. The latest six-unit accreditation is designed to equip all SAP users when engaging with support from SAP.

Support Accreditation learning journey on learning.sap.com

 

Why Support Accreditation Matters

Support Accreditation offers a quick, easy, and impactful way to upskill through a structured learning journey - empowering you and your teams to stay ahead. Here‚Äôs how it delivers impact:

  • Maximize Your SAP Investment: Learn how to unlock the full value of your SAP solutions by leveraging support resources for faster, more effective problem-solving.
  • Resolve Issues Proactively: Prevent disruptions and avoid escalations using self-service tools and real-time support capabilities.
  • Stay Ahead with Intelligent Support: Get familiar with SAP‚Äôs AI-driven and predictive support technologies to stay on the cutting edge.
  • Streamline Support Interactions: Reduce back-and-forth by understanding how to navigate SAP‚Äôs support channels and escalate efficiently.
  • Earn a Recognized Accreditation: Validate your knowledge with an official digital badge that demonstrates your expertise.
  • Follow Scenario-Based Learning Paths: Access tailored guidance for SAP Concur, Procurement, and explore key tools like SAP Cloud ALM.

Learning journey is easy to consume with relevant screenshots and walkthrough videos

Interactive yet easy quizzes for quick knowledge checks

 

What‚Äôs New in the Latest 2025 Release

The 2025 update to Support Accreditation introduces powerful new content designed to help you get even more from your SAP support tools and services. With the latest release, we have streamlined and updated the content to include the latest most relevant information while also introducing new units that can enhance your support services utilization and experience. Here's what‚Äôs new:

Customer Insights Dashboard: Your Command Center for the health of your SAP system

Monitor your SAP landscape with a single, interactive dashboard. View case statuses, usage statistics, service consumption, and more through tailored reports ‚Äî all in one place. The Customer Insights Dashboard will help you align support insights with business goals to improve decision-making and drive greater value.

Intelligent Search: Smarter Answers, Faster

No more wading through endless documents. The new AI-powered search in SAP for Me understands the intent behind your questions, not just the keywords. It connects you instantly to the most relevant documentation, KBAs, community posts, or embedded help content. With semantic understanding and vector-based retrieval, this is your shortcut to faster problem-solving and more confident self-service.

Support Interaction Survey: Your Voice, Our Action

Your feedback now directly shapes the future of SAP support. The Support Interaction Survey prompts you to share your experience after closing a case, whether positive or challenging. Low-effort scores trigger proactive follow-ups from our support managers, while high ratings help us celebrate and recognize excellence across our teams. Every response ensures your voice is heard and drives tangible improvements in the support you receive.

Strengthening Collaboration with SAP Partners: A Unified Experience

Collaboration just got more seamless with dedicated partner engagement section. Partner engagement and management in SAP for Me helps customers and partners work hand-in-hand with SAP support. With partner-specific dashboards, role-based access and analytics tools, this update empowers partners to deliver faster, more effective support on your behalf. The result? Greater visibility, smoother collaboration, and a stronger ecosystem working together for your success.

 

Get Started Today

With Support Accreditation, you‚Äôre not just learning, you‚Äôre future proofing your SAP journey. Whether you‚Äôre new to SAP or a seasoned professional, this is your opportunity to stay prepared, stay informed, and stay ahead.

Get accredited today at Support Accreditation on learning.sap.com

Check out our info-sheet for a quick overview on Support Accreditation.

Badge of completion issued as record of achievement

entry.title: New Critical Content Now Live in the SAP Support Portal: Empowering You with Faster, Smarter Support
entry.content:
We‚Äôre excited to introduce Critical Content, now available in the Support by Product Pages in the SAP Support Portal, bringing you faster access to the most essential resources for your product.

What Is Critical Content?

Critical Content includes expert-recommended articles and solutions that address the most severe issues‚Äîthose that could lead to major business disruptions if not addressed in time. These resources are now surfaced directly on your product‚Äôs support page, making it easier than ever to stay informed and take action.

You may already be familiar with Hot Content, which highlights major issues that could impact a large number of customers and typically result in support requests if no guidance is provided. Trending Content shows you what other customers are viewing most today. These are the most-accessed solutions across the platform‚Äîreal-time insights into what‚Äôs relevant and helpful right now.

Critical Content, on the other hand, focuses on high-impact issues specific to your product‚Äîthose that could cause serious business consequences if overlooked. It‚Äôs about proactive support, helping you resolve problems before they escalate.

Here it is a screen shot of a product page on the SAP Support Portal showing one Critical KBA as example:

See Also:

Expanding Proactive Solutions: Critical Content now Live in SAP for Me

Unlocking Proactive Solutions: Preventative Content now Live in SAP for Me

entry.title: SAP‚Äôs Commitment to Business Continuity that Protects what Matters
entry.content:
When people want to guard valuable items from their personal collections, they turn to protected places, such as banks, where they can rest safely, shielded from any unanticipated events. For centuries, individuals have entrusted institutions to safeguard what is most treasured by them, whether personal belongings or other assets. In the same fashion, SAP is dedicated to assisting customers protect their business value.

Disruptions can happen at any time. The difference stands in how well-prepared customers can be for these challenging periods. For example, Black Friday and Cyber Monday are the busiest shopping periods of the year for retailers. During these events, downtime or poor performance can cost millions in lost sales and customer trust, which could hamper core business operations.

Holiday Season Readiness Program

To support industries processes during these times, SAP enhanced the Holiday Season Readiness Program for Commerce Cloud customers. This joint initiative between Support, Engineering, and Cloud Operations ensured retailers were fully equipped with:

  • Introduction of a Preventative Care Model powered by AI and automation, using the Agentic AI framework to proactively detect and even resolve issues before they impacted customers.
  • Weekly health checks, 360¬∞ action plans, proactive cases, and a 24x7 global control room with real-time monitoring and on-site staffing.

SAP for Me

Aligned with our commitment to being a reliable partner, SAP for Me is evolving into a customer‚Äôs digital companion, in one of the most exciting innovations within SAP. It‚Äôs no longer just a portal; it‚Äôs becoming a central hub for transparency, guidance, and predictive insights. It holds:

  • AI-driven transparency - SAP for Me aggregates critical alerts, metrics, and insights across a customer‚Äôs entire SAP product portfolio. With the integration of Business AI, it now gives visibility into AI unit availability, consumption, and expirations, helping customers avoid surprises and plan proactively.
  • Proactive business assurance - Instead of waiting for a billing or system issue, SAP for Me provides real-time and predictive views into usage, health, and risks. For instance, customers can track consumption trends by product and feature, updated hourly, and receive early warnings when capacity is at risk.
  • Simplified control - All AI usage is linked to finance and legal statements, so customers get a single source of truth that connects technical consumption with business accountability. This prevents overspend, protects return on investment (ROI), and ensures contractual clarity.
  • Continuous innovation - SAP is expanding SAP for Me with embedded AI copilots and guided recommendations, so in the future, customers won‚Äôt just see metrics ‚Äî they‚Äôll get actionable guidance on how to optimize systems and safeguard value.

Ongoing support and maintenance are critical to sustaining business value with SAP systems. A successful go-live is just the starting point; systems need to remain secure, compliant, and optimized as business needs to evolve. With proactive monitoring, automation, and AI-driven insights, customers can prevent disruptions, reduce risk, and maintain high availability. In practice, this means lower operational costs, higher uptime, and continuous ROI over the entire lifecycle of their SAP investment.

Just as we expect care when trusting our valuables to others, SAP is committed to safeguarding business value, providing seamless experiences that protect decisive revenue and build sustained trust.

A special thanks to Keith Ho, Customer Engagement Lead, and Manoj Gupta, SAP experts who have contributed to this article.

entry.title: App Support - App Inspector now available from the Fiori Launchpad Home
entry.content:
If you support SAP Fiori users, you know the drill: a user reports ‚Äúmy app doesn‚Äôt open,‚Äù but your technical user doesn‚Äôt have that business role, or you‚Äôre on the Home screen wondering where to start. With the latest version of S/4 HANA 2025, you can launch App Inspector directly from the Fiori Launchpad Home via the familiar App Support entry ‚Äì and immediately browse a complete catalog of all applications available in the system, regardless of your assigned roles.

This builds on the App Support for SAP Fiori Launchpad capability described in the previous blog, and extends it with a system-wide catalog and more powerful search so supporters can find and troubleshoot any app faster.

What‚Äôs new

  • Same entry point, now usable from the Home screen Open the user menu on the Fiori Launchpad Home and choose App Support. No need to launch a specific app first.

  • Complete catalog of all apps in the system Browse everything available in the system, independent of your role assignments. Ideal for technical triage and landscape visibility.

  • More technical information for in-house support Quickly see technical identifiers and configuration details useful for troubleshooting (for example: Fiori app ID, component, intent, target mapping source, system alias, OData service, and more within App Inspector).

  • Powerful search Find apps by user, Fiori ID, Role, or Catalog ID. This helps you locate exactly the app a business user is referring to, even if you don‚Äôt have the same role assignment.

Access App Support - App Inspector through the Fiori Launchpad Home Screen

 

How it works

  1. From the Fiori Launchpad Home, open the user menu and select App Support.
  2. The App Support catalog view opens, listing all applications available in the system.
  3. Use search to locate an app:
    • By user: enter a user to see apps available for them.
    • By Fiori ID: use the SAP Fiori app ID you received in a ticket (for example, F1234).
    • By Role: search by a PFCG role name.
    • By Catalog ID: search by Fiori Launchpad catalog ID to review content organization.
  4. Select an application to open details. From there, launch App Inspector to analyze technical configuration and resolve issues such as:
    • Intent resolution and target mapping
    • Component and application version
    • System alias and destination
    • OData service bindings and backend availability
  5. Use deep links to open the app or share a link with colleagues. Capture findings and next steps directly from the Inspector view.

 

 

App Inspector list with filter options

Typical support scenarios this streamlines

  • A user reports an issue with a specific Fiori app ID. Search by Fiori ID, open the app details, and run App Inspector to verify configuration, intent, target mapping, and backend connectivity.

  • A supporter needs to confirm whether an app is present in the system and how it is exposed. Use the catalog and role or catalog search to see availability and assignments, even without business roles.

  • Triage ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt find my app‚Äù tickets. Search by user to compare what the user should see against catalog contents and identify role/catalog gaps.

  • Validate transports or configuration changes. Use App Inspector to check app versions and content source.

Detail view of an app in App Inspector

Availability and prerequisites

  • Entry point: App Support in the user menu on the Fiori Launchpad Home screen.
  • Feature set: App Inspector uses the same base as App Support and provides the technical analysis views described in the SAP Help.
  • Prerequisites: Ensure App Support and App Inspector are available and configured in your ABAP system. Appropriate authorizations are required to access support tooling and system-wide catalog content. For setup and configuration, refer to the SAP Help documentation:  https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/a7b390faab1140c087b8926571e942b7/94d8f974fcda459ea35dedd00c846603.html

Tips for adoption

  • Add App Support to your standard operating procedures for first-line Fiori triage.
  • Train supporters on search strategies (by user, Fiori ID, role, catalog) to shorten time-to-resolution.
  • Use App Inspector findings to create clear handoffs between frontend and backend teams.
  • Consider periodic catalog reviews to detect content inconsistencies across roles and catalogs.

What stays consistent

  • You still access App Support via the same user menu entry. The difference is that you can now start from the Home screen and immediately leverage the catalog without opening a specific app.

We‚Äôd love your feedback

Tell us how the catalog view and App Inspector help your support process. Which searches do you use most? What additional technical details would speed up your troubleshooting activities even more?

Further reading

  • App Support for the SAP Fiori Launchpad (previous blog): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/app-support-for-the-sap-fiori-launchpad/ba-p/13487591
  • App Inspector documentation: https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/a7b390faab1140c087b8926571e942b7/9306ad5bca61445089f1c901196b8135.html

With App Support now accessible from the Fiori Launchpad Home and a complete application catalog at your fingertips, supporters can locate, inspect, and resolve issues faster‚Äîwithout the overhead of business role assignments.

entry.title: How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID in SAP for Me
entry.content:
As an administrator managing user access in SAP for Me is a critical part of maintaining system security and operational efficiency. Whether you're onboarding new users as an admin, or adjusting access for existing ones, knowing how to properly assign and revoke authorization packages is essential. 

 

Why This Matters?

Authorization packages define what an S-user ID can access within the SAP for Me ecosystem‚Äîfrom support cases to license data, viewing systems, software download, etc. Keeping these permissions up to date ensures compliance, prevents unauthorized access, and streamlines user roles across your organization.

 

Steps:  

  1. Log in to SAP for Me using your S-user ID and password.  
  2.  In the SAP for Me homepage, click on ‚ÄúUsers & Contacts‚Äù tab under Dashboard at the left side of your screen.  
  3. Then, click on ‚ÄúManage Users & Authorization‚Äù card. Or simply go to‚ÄØUser Management.  
  4. Under the list of users, find the S-user ID to unassign the authorization package from. Or simply use the search field to search for the specific S-user ID and click on the magnifying glass to search.  
  5. Click on the user/S-user ID (not the checkbox).
  6. Click on the‚ÄØEXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES‚ÄØtab.  
  7. Click the Edit (Pencil) icon on the top right of that section. 
  8. Click on the checkbox in front of the Authorization Package(s) to be removed. 
  9. Click OK. 
  10. Click‚ÄØSave‚ÄØon the top right of the EXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES section. 

     

For more details, please refer to Knowledge Base Article: 2878696 - How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID - SAP for Me. 

 

Got More Questions?‚ÄØ 

The Customer Interaction Center is always ready to support you with any of the listed processes and is happy to assist with questions regarding case-related matters, SAP for Me navigation, S-user ID, or SAP Universal ID. 

 

Alternatively,‚ÄØplease‚ÄØfeel free to‚ÄØask‚ÄØus in the Q&A ‚ÄØ‚ÄØAll Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community‚ÄØand‚ÄØAll Questions in Support Services | SAP Community 

 

Don't‚ÄØMiss Out on Free Webcasts‚ÄØ 

We would like to invite you to our free webcasts, which we believe can help you get the best from your support in SAP. You can find all upcoming webcasts on‚ÄØhttps://events.sap.com/supportwebcasts/en/home.‚ÄØThese sessions are open to all the users and will revolve around hot topics in support today such as SAP for Me, Case Management, Universal ID, etc. Additionally, you can explore a range of CIC how-to videos at‚ÄØlearning.sap.com.‚ÄØPlease feel free to share this information with your colleagues. We are looking forward to your attendance.‚ÄØ 

 

Lastly, you may want to access all Customer Interaction Center Blogs here:‚ÄØ‚ÄØhttps://community.sap.com/t5/tag/CustomerInteractionCenter/tg-p/board-id/crm-blog-sap. 

 

Thanks‚ÄØfor reading! ‚ÄØWe hope you found this guide helpful.‚ÄØ

entry.title: Smarter Built-In Support in C4C: A Unified and Upgraded Experience
entry.content:
Built-In Support Upgrade Coming with Release 2511

! Only available after 15/11/2025  ( subject to change) !

With the upcoming 2511 release, SAP Sales & Service Cloud (V1) receives a major upgrade to its built-in support experience.
Customers will continue to report issues directly from within their tenant , now through the next-generation Built-In Support, seamlessly integrated with SAP for Me.

 This is the same modern Built-In Support already available in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 and other SAP Cloud solutions , bringing V1 fully in line with SAP‚Äôs unified support model.

 Flexibility by Design

Customers now have complete flexibility:

  • create and manage SAP support cases directly from their tenant using Built-In Support 

  • work entirely from SAP for Me,

  • or switch freely between both , all cases are fully synchronized and managed centrally.

 

* only key user can access built in support and forward cases to SAP.

 The Best of Both Worlds

This evolution brings the best of both worlds:
‚úÖthe in-application convenience customers already know,
‚úÖcombined with the powerful tools and insights available in SAP for Me , including real-time support channels, intelligent search, guided assistance, and complete case management.

The result: a smarter, faster, and more unified support experience across SAP‚Äôs ecosystem.

‚ÄÉ

What‚Äôs New in Built-In Support

The new Built-In Support delivers choice, speed, and intelligence:

  • Real-time support options: Expert Chat, Schedule an Expert, Ask an Expert Peer

  • AI-powered search and guided support assistant for quicker solutions

  • Rich text editing and larger attachments for clearer communication

  • Enhanced case logging with guided steps to select the right priority and document business impact

  • Instant synchronization with SAP for Me (no more 15-minute delays)

  • Accurate case ownership , the creator is correctly identified in SAP for Me 

  • Unified access across all SAP cloud solutions

  • Enhanced reporting and dashboards in SAP for Me, Cloud availability insights, Central case management, Cloud availability insights, Trust Center, etc

This upgrade also aligns C4C V1 with the same built-in support experience already available in V2, ensuring a consistent and future-ready support model across the SAP portfolio..

Learn more:
‚û°Ô∏èGetting Support Using Built in Support 

We recommend to consider completed the support accreditation which also covers the features and benefits of Built in Support

What Stays the Same

We‚Äôre not changing your familiar workflow , Key Users can still create and track their own cases directly in your C4C tenant.
Built-In Support remains embedded, now simply smarter, faster, and seamlessly connected to SAP for Me.

End user management remains accessible with he old tool but is limited to internal support only.

 

 Why This Upgrade Matters

The original Built-In Support in C4C V1 was based on legacy technology that limited access to newer SAP innovations.

With the upgraded Built-In Support and SAP for Me integration, customers now benefit from:

  • A modern, AI-enabled experience

  • Real-time engagement with SAP experts

  • Centralized visibility across products

  • Smarter case handling and improved CES outcomes

This is not a change in workflow,  it‚Äôs an upgrade to a faster, smarter, and more flexible support experience.

 What to Expect Next

  • The upgrade is planned  with the 2511 release.

  • Existing open cases from the legacy built-in support will become editable in SAP for Me.

    SAP Knowledge Base Article  3665054 - How to Find and Process, in SAP for Me, Cases created from a ByD or C4C tenant

  • We recommend verifying that all relevant users have valid S-user IDs and access to SAP for Me. Built in support requires to sign in with a valid S user  to access case management and case creation

 

Summary

The new Built-In Support in SAP Sales & Service Cloud (V1) is a smarter, faster, and more flexible way to connect with SAP Support.

You can now:
‚úÖCreate cases from your tenant (via Built-In Support)
‚úÖManage them in SAP for Me
‚úÖAccess real-time support channels
‚úÖBenefit from AI guidance and enhanced reporting

All fully synchronized ‚Äî giving you one unified experience powered by Built-In Support and SAP for Me.
This is the future of SAP Support.

üìöFurther Reading

Relevant Links

  • 3676368 - Onboarding C4C Customers Into New Built in Support - SAP for Me - SAP for Me
  • SAP Support Portal Landing Page‚Äã
  • Built-In Support Documentation ‚Äã
  • SAP News Center Article‚Äã
  • SAP Knowledge Base Article 3000949 - How to create a support case in Built-In Support
  • SAP Knowledge Base Article 3584368 - How to log in to Built-In Support and activate support functions
  • Partners can use their own S users when following these steps : 3661864 - "Manage Service Partner Users" SAP4ME Card for ByD Partners - SAP for Me

  • Known Limitations of Built-In Support

  • Customer Help Desk (CHD) or Customer Competence Center (CCC), or Partner Scenario
    • Tickets can only be forwarded either from the Central Key User or from a partner tenant using the new BIS.
    • If a partner setup is connected to the CHD server tenant (central Key User tenant), and a Central Key User has already forwarded a case to the Partner, they should not forward the same case again through the new BIS to avoid duplicate case submissions to SAP.
      Note: KBA 2611988 - To know more about the CCC and CHD Process.
       
  • There is no automatic synchronization for older cases with the new BIS. Since the Forward to Provider option is disabled, you can only contact SAP through the new BIS. For existing tickets, you can update them directly in SAP for Me.
    For more details, refer to 3665054 - How to Find and Process, in SAP for Me, Cases created from a ByD or C4C tenant.
  • The change does not apply to tenants hosted in China.

entry.title: How to Find and Process, in SapforMe , Cases created from a ByD or C4C Version 1 tenant
entry.content:
If in C4C or ByD built in support is not accessible , it is possible to fully process a case directly from SAPfor Me.

  • Login  to the support portal https://support.sap.com/en/index.html or access SAPforMe directly  : https://me.sap.com/home
  • Ensure you are accessing the portal with a  S user that belong to the correct account which should be the account containing the C4C or ByD installation. Your user must have  Case management access, read and write.

If you are unsure which S user to use, or whether you had the necessary access rights,  please check with our Customer interraction center

Our non technical hotline can be used, 24/7 for all  case access issues, case management, escalation request, call back, S-User management, etc.  more info : https://support.sap.com/en/contact-us.html?anchorId=section_42886245

  • Once logged to SAPforMe you can check if the S users is correct. Only a S user that belongs to the same installation and account as your tenant will let you manage your cases.

 

  • Navigate to ‚Äúservice & Support‚Äù to access all opened cases

  • Open ‚Äúview‚Äù cases

If you case was opened from the legacy built in support in C4C or ByD, you will likely not be the person assigned to the case, you can easily find all tenant relevant cases  with the filter option.  The New C4C V1 Built In Support will always display the correct user.

  • If you case is still in progress, status should be anything except for ‚Äúconfirmed‚Äù, ‚Äú not sent to SAP‚Äù and ‚Äúautomatically confirmed‚Äù

You can further filter using the ‚Äúsystem‚Äù field which is your tenant ID.

  • To find your tenant ID, open your tenant, go to the Work Center ‚ÄúService Control Center‚Äù -> ‚Äúsystem‚Äù.

From this view all tenant under your account will be visible

  • Copy the tenant ID in the filter field  of SAPforMe and it will display only the cases created from these tenants.

  • You can then edit your case and resume processing. For any support regarding case management, please contact CIC.
  • If you are not the reporter of the case you can add yourself as new contact in order to receive all case related notification

If you mark  one or multiple case as favorite , they will be displayed  on your SAPforMe Home page and you will be able to access them without searching again

 

Conclusion
With SAP for Me, managing ByD and C4C cases becomes simpler and more consistent , even when built-in support isn‚Äôt accessible. By following these steps, you can easily locate, filter, and process your cases directly from SAP for Me without interruptions. This unified experience ensures you stay connected to SAP Support, benefit from real-time synchronization, and keep all your customer interactions in one place.

entry.title: SAP Universal ID Update: New Authentication Strategy and Self-Service Features
entry.content:
Users will no longer authenticate using their SAP Universal ID. Instead, the SAP Universal ID will function solely as a "wallet", enabling users to link and manage all their user identities in the‚ÄØSAP Universal ID Account Manager. Authentication will be handled through these linked accounts, not the SAP Universal ID itself. These broader identity renovation strategy advancements underscore SAP‚Äôs commitment to simplifying the user experience across its platforms by creating a more unified, secure, and user-friendly login experience across the SAP ecosystem in the future. 

 Self-service for identity Management to make changes to how will use the SAP Universal ID in the future and how it will authenticate with SAP's digital platforms  

 The SAP Universal ID Account Manager is a centralized portal where individuals can manage their unique personal SAP identity (Universal ID). It allows users to view and update personal details, manage security settings, link and consolidate various SAP user IDs (like S-user, P-user IDs), and retain their SAP community reputation and learning certificates across different employment changes. It acts as a single point of access to manage all SAP-related information and services in one place. 

 

https://account.sap.com/sam/ 

 

 

 

 

 New Features 

 Self-service for Identity Unlinking 

Users will be able to unlink specific users or email addresses with multiple users for the SAP Universal ID using the new self-service in the application 

 

Improved Flow for Adding New Identities 

The process for adding new Identity (previously called Add Accounts) has been streamlined: 

  • If an email already exists in the system, it automatically links it to SAP Universal ID (eliminating a previous manual linking step) 
  • If no user exists for that email ‚Äì the user is prompted to set up a password and a new P-user is automatically created in Identity Services. New identity is automatically linked to SAP Universal ID. 

 

 

Recovery Identity Prompt and Notification 

In case there is an email that was previously added to SAP Universal ID but there is no P/S-user ID associated with that email, the customer is prompted to make a choice ‚Äì either remove that email from SAP Universal ID or create a recovery identity that can be used for authentication across applications 

If ‚ÄúAdd Identity‚Äù option is selected, the customer is asked to enter a password, and a P-user is automatically created in IDS. New identity is automatically linked to SAP Universal ID. 

 

 

 In case there is only one email linked to SAP Universal ID; a notification is displayed reminding users of the benefits of having a recovery identity 

 

Removal of Mandatory SAP Universal ID Registration for New S-user IDs 

It is no longer mandatory to create an SAP Universal ID for a new S-user ID. Customers can decide if they want to link the S-user ID to an SAP Universal ID or keep the user on its own. This is a step in preparation to the new authentication strategy to be implemented later this year. 

 

 

Thanks for reading!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
 
 
We would love to hear from you, let us know what you think?‚ÄØ 

If you have any questions,‚ÄØplease‚ÄØfeel free to‚ÄØask‚ÄØus in the Q&A‚ÄØAll Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community‚ÄØand‚ÄØAll Questions in Support Services | SAP Community‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ Read more #Customer Interaction Centre‚ÄØblog posts‚ÄØHere!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

Customer Experience - SAP Community  

Official SAP Community. Search questions and answers, read the latest blog posts and curated content, connect with experts, and improve your SAP skills.

entry.title: Read more on Confirmed' or 'Confirmed Automatically cases and what can be done?
entry.content:
Here is all you need to know if a case is confirmed or confirmed automatically, and you still need support from SAP 

What does Confirmed and Automatically Confirmed mean?  

Confirmed ‚Äî The case was closed by the customer and can no longer be reopened. The case can be found in the Closed Cases section of the case list.   

If a case is ‚Äòconfirmed automatically‚Äô it means that case was in one of the below statuses for over 21 days with no response from the customer and can no longer be reopened.   

  • Customer Action  
  • SAP Proposed Solution  

Read more on this here SAP Knowledge Base Article (KBA) 1929454‚ÄØ- What is the time for the automatic closure of support‚ÄØcases and 2537073 - What is the time for automatic closure of support  

 A case that is 'Confirmed' or 'Confirmed Automatically‚Äô cannot be reopened however what can be done with a valid S-user ID within the organization and has the correct authorizations is create A New Case - About the User, Authorization, and Administrator Concept   

When creating the new case ( 1296527 - How to create a support case for SAP Support - SAP for Me) when filling out the  Description ensure to mention the previous case number that is confirmed.   

 

The relevant team will then know that the new case is related to a previous one that is confirmed, and the new case will be picked up from where the previous case was processed.

We suggest that if SAP has requested information on the confirmed case, you should include the reply in the new case to ensure the most efficient support.  

Thanks for reading!‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ  

We hope you found this useful.

Please note that the‚ÄØCustomer Interaction Center‚ÄØis always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you‚ÄØmay have.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ  

If you have any questions, please ask a question in the Q & A using‚ÄØAll Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community‚ÄØand‚ÄØAll Questions in Support Services | SAP Community‚ÄØ  

Read more #CustomerInteractionCenter‚ÄØblogposts "CustomerInteractionCenter" - SAP Community ‚ÄØ

entry.title: Navigating the SAP Learning Help Center: Your Gateway to Seamless Learning Support!
entry.content:
Embarking on a journey through SAP‚Äôs extensive ecosystem can be both exciting and challenging. Whether you‚Äôre an experienced professional looking to enhance your skills or a newcomer eager to explore SAP‚Äôs offerings, having dependable support is essential. That‚Äôs where the SAP Learning Help Center comes in‚Äîa comprehensive resource designed to support learners at every step of their SAP learning journey.

 

This centralized portal offers a wide range of resources, including step-by-step guides, troubleshooting advice, and detailed FAQs, all aimed at improving your learning experience. From onboarding assistance to resolving technical issues, the Help Center is your one-stop destination for reliable support.

Before submitting a support ticket, please take a moment to explore our Help Center resources for quick answers and solutions

In this blog, we will explore the key features of the SAP Learning Help Center, highlight common scenarios where learners seek assistance, and share tips on how to make the most of this valuable resource.

 

Common Scenarios for Creating a Support Case with the Learning Team:

You may need to open a support case in the following situations:

  1. Difficulty scheduling exams
  2. Requests to update names on existing certificates
  3. Questions regarding subscription or renewal processes
  4. Seeking guidance on choosing the right certification path
  5. Issues related to student subscription accounts

 

How to Create a Case with the Learning Team

To create a support case, please follow these steps:                 

Visit the SAP Learning Help Center.

 

Select Create a new case or check the status of an existing one.

 

Click on Create a case, which will open the SAP Learning Self Service(s) page.

Click Create Case again to open the form, then fill in the required details:

    • Subject
    • Service Category
    • Description
    • Email of affected user (optional)
    • Attach any relevant files (if applicable)

Submit the form.

 

 

Once submitted, your case will be created, and you will receive an email notification linked to your S-User ID with the case details.

Additional Resources:

  • Knowledge Base Article (KBA): 2404504 - How to get help with the SAP Learning Hub or SAP Training Center - SAP for Me
  • Points of Contact | SAP Community

 Thanks for reading!

We hope you found this helpful. Please note that the Customer Interaction Center is always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you may have!

We would love to hear from you, let us know what you think?

Read more Customer Interaction Center blog posts Here!

 If you have any questions, please feel free to ask us in the Q&A All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community and All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community

entry.title: A Smarter Support Experience
entry.content:
Your support experience is evolving. Key changes and what you need to know.

As part of our ongoing efforts to make support from SAP smarter and easier for you, we have been piloting new ways to optimize the support experience and better connect you with the right channels and the right experts. We are excited to share that these improvements are now live. 

What‚Äôs changing 

As your entry point, the ‚ÄúGet Support‚Äù application has been enhanced to make it easier to create and manage your support cases. 

  • A clearer, unified navigation structure now guides you through case creation, with each step accessible from the left-hand pane. 
  • The detailed description field has been moved to the beginning of the process‚Äîhelping you provide important context earlier and improving the quality of AI-driven recommendations. 
  • Improved UI consistency and AI disclosure messages to make the interface more transparent, intuitive, and ready for future innovation. 

In particular, the Incident Solution Matching (ISM) service has been further enriched with generative AI (GenAI) capabilities. Based on the information you provide, the service compiles relevant solutions and summarizes them into a single, easy-to-read answer‚Äîcomplete with links to the original knowledge articles used. 

The GenAI feature is being rolled out to customers in phases, starting with a limited group and expanding over time. It includes a feedback option to continuously refine your experience. 

When you create a case, you may receive a recommended priority based on your case details. This helps guide your selection so your case can reach the right experts and most suitable support channel, helping to enhance the overall resolution time. You remain in full control and can always adjust the priority to reflect your business impact or urgency. 

 

New customer view in 'Get Support' application

Set up your case for faster resolution 

To help ensure your case reaches the right experts as quickly as possible: 

  • Write a concise title for the issue that states the key symptom. 
  • Use the detailed description section to provide evidence, error messages, recent changes, and attempted fixes. 
  • Select the correct system that is affected by the technical issue you want to report 
  • Select the most accurate product, function, or component. 
  • Clearly describe the business impact, along with any workarounds in place 
  • Keep your case updated if conditions change and add feedback if you adjust the proposed priority. 

Thank you for partnering with us as we continue to transform support from SAP into an experience that is smarter and more effective for you.
